case_vignette: A man, aged 42 years, presents with a 6-month history of a painful, scaly skin rash. The eruption is symmetrically distributed over photosensitive areas, affecting his face, neck, upper back, forearms, and hands. The dorsal surfaces of his hands and forearms exhibit a dusky brown coloration over rough and cracked skin. He complains of itching and burning and reports intermittent vomiting and diarrhea. He admits to heavy alcohol intake for the last 2 decades and denies taking any medications. Neuropsychiatric evaluation reveals short-term memory loss, speech problems, and poor concentration.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful, scaly skin rash, itching, burning, intermittent vomiting, diarrhea, and I've also been experiencing short-term memory loss, speech problems, and poor concentration.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for 6 months.
Have you been diagnosed with any previous medical conditions or are you currently under any medication?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with any medical conditions and I am not taking any medications.
Have you noticed if these symptoms get worse after eating certain types of food like mushrooms or corn?
I haven't noticed if my symptoms worsen after eating specific foods like mushrooms or corn.
Do you have any family history of similar symptoms or other neurological or skin conditions?
I haven't mentioned any family history of similar symptoms or other neurological or skin conditions.
Have you been exposed to any new environments or substances, such as chemicals, heavy metals, or unusual foods prior to the onset of your symptoms?
No, I have not been exposed to any new environments or substances prior to the onset of my symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Cerebral folate deficiency syndrome
